abstract: Loads the Java classes located in the specified bundle.
overview:
## Overview

Loads and returns the Java classes in the specified bundle. If the Java virtual machine is not loaded, load it first. A reference to the Java virtual machine is returned in the `vm` parameter. You can pass `nil` for the `vm` parameter if you do not want this information. Pass [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for `usesyscl` if you want to use a new instance of the class loader to load the classes; otherwise, the system can reuse an existing instance of the class loader. If you pass [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for `usesyscl`, the new class loader will be released when you are done with it; otherwise, the class loader will be cached for use next time.

# NSJavaClassesForBundle

**Article**

Loads the Java classes located in the specified bundle.

## Overview

Loads and returns the Java classes in the specified bundle. If the Java virtual machine is not loaded, load it first. A reference to the Java virtual machine is returned in the `vm` parameter. You can pass `nil` for the `vm` parameter if you do not want this information. Pass [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for `usesyscl` if you want to use a new instance of the class loader to load the classes; otherwise, the system can reuse an existing instance of the class loader. If you pass [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for `usesyscl`, the new class loader will be released when you are done with it; otherwise, the class loader will be cached for use next time.
title: NSJavaClassesForBundle
